Anggota DPRD Padang Dukung Mobil 'Ngocok Yuk' Diamankan: Bikin Gaduh
01 Nov 2019, 10:25 by Jeka Kampai
Padang - Satpol PP Kota Padang, Sumatera Barat, menyita mobil pedagang minuman 'Ngocok Yuk' yang merupakan akronim dari 'ngopi cokelat'. Anggota DPRD Kota Padang Irawati Meuraksa, mendukung langkah Satpol PP.
"Sudah tepat. Pas. Bagi kami, apa yang dilakukan Satpol PP itu semata-mata untuk menjaga ketertiban umum," kata anggota DPRD Kota Padang, Irawati Meuraksa kepada detikcom, Jumat (1/11/2019).
Politikus PAN itu menilai penggunaan nama-nama aneh serta dianggap memiliki makna negatif dapat menimbulkan keresahan.
"Banyak cara untuk berbisnis. Banyak cara untuk mencari popularitas, tapi baiknya tidak menggunakan nama-nama seperti itu. Membuat resah dan membuat gaduh," katanya.
"Ini (Kota) Padang. Bukan hanya soal banyaknya warga muslim, tapi juga aneh kalau dilihat orang-orang," tambah dia.
Selain minuman 'Ngocok Yuk', Ira juga menyoroti soal makanan yang mengandung konotasi negatif lainnya seperti 'Mie Neraka', 'Mie Setan', 'Mie Carut' atau merek-merek negatif lainnya.
"Satpol PP perlu menindak hal-hal seperti ini," tegas Ira.
DPRD Kota Padang saat ini tengah mendorong adanya Perda tentang larangan penggunaan nama-nama aneh yang bisa memicu kegaduhan. Perda itu diharapkan bisa memperkuat Perda Ketertiban Umum (Tibum) yang sudah ada.
Satpol PP Kota Padang, Sumatera Barat, menyita gerobak pedagang minuman yang menggunakan nama berasosiasi negatif, 'Ngocok Yuk'. Kalimat itu masih ditambahi 'Makin Dikocok, Makin Nikmat'. 'Ngocok' sendiri merupakan plesetan dari minuman 'Ngopi Coklat'.
"Memang kita sita, karena sudah meresahkan masyarakat. Banyak yang protes, karena nama-nama seperti itu tak bagus untuk dilihat," kata Kepala Satpol PP Kota Padang, Al Amin kepada wartawan, Kamis (31/10).
Penyitaan baru dilakukan terhadap sebuah Mobil Carry penuh tulisan 'ngocok' di Kawasan Stadion Agus Salim Padang. Kendaraan bersama pemilik serta barang dagangannya diangkut ke Markas Satpol PP.
Menurut Al Amin, penggunaan nama dan brand seperti itu sangat mengganggu dan melanggar norma dan agama.
"Kita menerima laporan adanya brand usaha kopi coklat 'Ngocok Yuk, Makin Dikocok Makin Nikmat' itu. Setelah kita datangi ternyata memang benar dan selanjutnya kita bawa ke kantor," kata dia.

Padang Legislative Council Member Supports 'Ngukul Yuk' Car Secured: Making Gaduh
Nov 1, 2019, 10:25 by Jeka Kampai
Padang - Satpol PP Kota Padang, West Sumatra, seized the 'Ngocok Yuk' beverage merchant car, an acronym for 'chocolate coffee'. Member of Padang City DPRD, Irawati Meuraksa, supports the Satpol PP step.
"It's right. Pas. For us, what was done by Satpol PP was solely to maintain public order," said Padang City DPRD member, Irawati Meuraksa, told AFP on Friday (1/11/2019).
The PAN politician assessed the use of strange names and was considered to have negative meanings that could cause unrest.
"There are many ways to do business. There are many ways to find popularity, but it's good not to use names like that. Make you uneasy and make noise," he said.
"This (Padang) is Padang. It's not just a matter of the large number of Muslims, but it's also strange when people see it," he added.
Aside from the 'Ngukul Yuk' drink, Ira also highlighted foods that contain other negative connotations such as 'Hell Noodles', 'Mie Setan', 'Mie Carut' or other negative brands.
"Satpol PP needs to crack down on things like this," said Ira.
The Padang City DPRD is currently pushing for a regional regulation on the prohibition of using strange names that could trigger a commotion. The Regional Regulation is expected to strengthen the existing Regional Order (Tibum) Law.
City of Padang, West Sumatra, Satpol PP seized a beverage merchant wagon that used the negative association name, 'Ngukul Yuk'. The sentence is still added 'The More Shaken, the More Enjoyed'. 'Shaking' itself is a play on the 'Coffee Chocolate' drink.
"Indeed, we confiscated it, because it has upset the public. Many are protesting, because names like that are not good to look at," Head of the Padang City Police Satpol PP, Al Amin, told reporters on Thursday (10/31).
The new confiscation was carried out on a Carry Car full of 'shaking' words in the Agus Salim Stadium Stadium in Padang. The vehicle along with the owner and his merchandise are transported to the PP Satpol Headquarters.
According to Al Amin, the use of such names and brands is very disturbing and violates norms and religion.
"We received a report on the existence of the chocolate coffee business brand 'Ngukul Yuk, More Shaken and More Delicious'. After we went it turned out to be true and then we took it to the office," he said.
